bug.author: prihoda
bug.summary: Sentence prediction task does not add BOS token
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>üêõ Bug</denchmark-h>
I noticed that even though the code expects the BOS token to be present in sentence prediction ( <denchmark-link:https://github.com/pytorch/fairseq/blob/master/fairseq/models/roberta/model.py#L273>https://github.com/pytorch/fairseq/blob/master/fairseq/models/roberta/model.py#L273</denchmark-link> ), it is actually not added by the task. Is this expected behavior? I guess the task still works, but might produce unexpected results when different tokens appear at the first position. <denchmark-h:h3>To Reproduce</denchmark-h>
This is clear from the code, but can be validated by running test_roberta_sentence_prediction test in test_binaries.py in debug mode and inspecting the input dataset. <denchmark-h:h3>Expected behavior</denchmark-h>
BOS token should be added by task, same as in the task: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/pytorch/fairseq/blob/master/fairseq/tasks/masked_lm.py#L126>https://github.com/pytorch/fairseq/blob/master/fairseq/tasks/masked_lm.py#L126</denchmark-link>
<denchmark-h:h3>Environment</denchmark-h>
N/A

comments.comment: Never mind, I didn't realize you are supposed to use --init-token 0
